reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, whoever scouted the location for this Istanbul hotel should be fired. The hotel is located about a mile from Taksim Square, but not on a main road, but rather down a steep alley. There is nothing around it but auto shops. To get to anywhere requires either a taxi or a walk about a steep alley to a main street. That being said, the inside of the hotel is adequate. Indeed, the rooms are a little bigger than normal. Since it is a relatively new hotel, I need to cut it some slack for the off and on television, off and on internet(in the business area), and the lack of availability of reserved room due to "technical difficulties". To compensate my friend and I received a suite, but with only one bed. I had one night on an uncomfortable cot. The room was in the front of the hotel on the second floor, so all the outside noise saturated the room. The second room (for the final four nights) was much better. It was a double room (two twin beds) in the back of the hotel. The difference in the noise factor was enormous. Due to the mixup on our arrival, we received one morning's complimentary breakfast...It was quite good but I would never pay the 20 euro tab per person. We did receive some excellent assistance from Ghokahn. He was a reall asset. As a tip, if you go up the alley onto the main street, the street has a fork in the road. If you go to the right, by the Military Museum, you will enter a very upscale neighborhood with a number of upscale shops and restaurants. If you veer to the left, after about a mile, you will encounter a very westernized mall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. The hotel itself is quite nice and modern, the rooms are large and also the bathrooms are nice and big. But the location is not so good. The area is not so nice and it is not easy to get to. On the internet homepage of the hotel there is information stating that Taksim square is within walking distance but this is not so true, it takes about 15 minutes to walk there. If you want to go somewhere you either need to take a taxi or walk to the metro station, it takes about two minutes. So if you like travelling with metro it´s okey. If you prefer a high standard hotel before location you can choose this hotel. But if location is very important, don´t stay here.
reviews.title: Okey hotel but bad location

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week late September 2011. Many positives - large room with a very comfortable bed. Free wifi was great. Restaurant good but slightly expensive. Breakfasts great. Good club floor, and a club lounge with a roof terrace on the 12th floor. The staff are outstanding. Everyone - doormen, reception staff, and the Guest Relations Manager, go out of their way to ensure that you have a good stay with them. Great looking spa and pool, but having to wear a rubber swimming cap on your head put us off!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Amazing Staff

reviews.text: Other reviewers have criticised the location. Its not the most amazing choice of location amongst the car repair shops, but its perfectly safe, and its very convenient. Many will like not being in the "touristy" area!! Local shops are up by Osmanbey metro station, a 300 yard uphill (steep!!) walk. Taksim Square is a 10/12 minute walk, or a short and cheap taxi ride away.

reviews.text: I was in Istanbul for a global conference with my Organization and I can't say enough about the accommodations, the breakfasts and lunches, and the conference venue. All in all the staff were wonderful, the rooms amazing, and the free wireless a bonus. While the hotel is not exactly near the Old Town, we enjoyed walking over to Taksim at night where there were plenty of restaurants to choose from, and when we felt more adventurous, we took a cab over to the Old Town, and Ayasofya Mosque area -- (20 mins max). I highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, average location

reviews.text: I stayed here, mid October and just to address what others have mentioned about the location; yes it may not be ideal and not Taksim, but to be fair, much of Istanbul looks like this and though it may look suspect, I walked around at night without any problems.
